Description: Rectangular calcite tablet bearing seven incised columns of Hieroglyphic text naming seven oils used in Opening of Mouth Ceremony; seven circular oil-wells.
Curator's comments: Published: Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt, Japan 1999-2000, [63] Sacred Food, Barcelona 2001, p. 201 [85] These oils are mentioned in the Coffin Texts and were used in the Opening of the Mouth ceremony, a ritual which was intended animate statues or re-animate the mummified deceased. Bibliography: M. Rochholz, ‘Zu den Paletten für die Salböle’, in ‘Wege offnen: Festschrift fur Rolf Gundlach zun 65. Geburtstag’, (1996), pp. 223-231.
